brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts a Windows XP command prompt screenshot using the n s lookup command. The default DNS server is listed along with its IP address. At the n s lookup command prompt, www.cisco.com and cisco.netacad.net are entered. Their IP addresses are returned as output, along with the name of the DNS server that provided the information.
For example:
When n s lookup www.cisco.com is entered at a command prompt, the following output is displayed:
Server: dns-sj.cisco.com
Address: 171.70.168.183
